body: @wheelcomplex, could you also print out the last entry after the `i386_ldt_grow`? I may just be failing to follow the maze of twisty passages, but I can't find anywhere that the newly allocated area of the LDT is zeroed. If the allocation gets non-zeroed memory, then the loop that looks for a free entry by checking SDT_SYSNULL could fail to find anything even if it just grew the LDT to make room.
